current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide a
		  credit for employer-provided job training, and for other
		  purposes.

text.#text: For purposes of

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:

				for any taxable year is the aggregate amount of the costs paid or incurred in
				such taxable year for expenses necessary for and directly related to the
				conduct of a Qualified Job Training Partnership in the form of contributions of
				cash, cash equivalent, equipment, or any combination of the three where 100
				percent of the investment is used for the planning, implementation, or
				operation of a Qualified Job Training Partnership and the training financed
				through the investment must result in a type of certificate or credential
